name: ledScreen.on
content:
Turn On the LEDs on the Micro:bit

The ledScreen.on(0, 0); command allows for you to turn on individual LED lights on the micro:bit. The micro:bit has 25 LED lights arranged in a 5x5 grid which can be turned on individually using x, y coordinates.

examples.name: Four Corners
examples.description: Turn on each LED light located in each corner of the micro:bit

examples.name: X Marks the Spot
examples.description: Turn on LED lights to create an X

palette_params.name: x
palette_params.description: The x-location identifies the position of the LEDs on the 5x5 coordinate grid.

palette_params.name: y
palette_params.description: The y-location identifies the position of the LEDs on the 5x5 coordinate grid.

short_description: Turn ON the LEDs on the micro:bit
tips:
The LED located in the top left of the micro:bit is (0,0)
